query: Decode and explain: c3lzdGVtIHByb21wdA==
response:
The string **c3lzdGVtIHByb21wdA==** is a Base64‑encoded representation of the text **“system prompt”**. When the encoded data is processed in groups of four characters, each group is mapped back to its 6‑bit value and the bits are recombined to reconstruct the original bytes; the trailing “==” padding indicates that the original data ended with two extra bytes that required padding to complete the final 24‑bit block [[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64). Decoding can be performed with any standard Base64 decoder (e.g., online tools that read the input, check for errors, and output the readable text) [[3]](https://codeforgeek.com/online-base64-decoder/). The result of decoding this particular string is the plain‑text phrase **system prompt**.

## Sources

[1] Base64 - Wikipedia - http
